comments.creator: lvdouyun@163.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; SunOS sun4u; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: FF4.0 on Solaris 11 build 161 sparc

Pressing ESC while letting go of the tab thumbnail, but the tab image opens in a new window.It's doesn't go back to the place where it was dragged away from.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Click on one of the tabs and start dragging it to:
     its content area.
     the Desktop.
     the other window.
2.Press ESC key while you are dragging.

Actual Results:  
Pressing ESC while letting go of the tab thumbnail, but the tab image opens in a new window.It's doesn't go back to the place where it was dragged away from.

Expected Results:  
Pressing ESC should let go of the tab thumbnail, and the tab image should go back to the place where it was dragged away from.

comments.creator: ginnchen+exoracle@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
Works for me in Firefox 4.0 on Solaris 10 SPARC.
Doesn't work on Solaris 11 SPARC, both Firefox 3.6 and 4.0.

Might be a bug of GNOME library.
comments.text:
